{{cpp/atomic/atomic/title|is_always_lock_free}}
{{cpp/atomic/atomic/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++17|1=
static constexpr bool is_always_lock_free = /*implementation-defined*/;
}}

Equals {{c|true}} if this atomic type is always lock-free and {{c|false}} if it is never or sometimes lock-free.

The value of this constant is consistent with both the macro {{tt|ATOMIC_xxx_LOCK_FREE}}, where defined, with the member function {{lc|is_lock_free}} and non-member function {{lc|std::atomic_is_lock_free}}.

===Notes===
There is no non-member function equivalent of this static member constant because non-member functions take pointers to atomic types, and therefore aren't as useful in {{lt|cpp/language/constant expression}}s.

{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_atomic_is_always_lock_free|{{tt|constexpr atomic&lt;T&gt;::is_always_lock_free}}|value=201603L|std=C++17}}
